model

Class InitJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.InitJDBC

  • public class InitJDBC
extends java.lang.Object
    This class connect to the DataBase and have the attributes for Table, View and Trigger
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gurvan LORANS and Samuel LE BERRE

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.sql.Connection connection
      This attribute will make the connection to the DB
      private java.lang.String db_Name
      This string correspond to the name of the DataBase
      private Table table
      This attribute is the Table class
      private Trigger trigger
      This attribute is the Trigger class
      private View view
      This attribute is the View class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InitJDBC(java.lang.String dbName)
      This method will connect user to the DB without send any query

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connectDriver()
      This method will connect the driver JDBC
      void connectionDB(java.lang.String db_name)
      This method connect the user to the DataBase
      java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Get the Connection object
      java.lang.String getDb_Name()
      Get the name of the DataBase
      Table getTable()
      Get the Table
      Trigger getTrigger()
      Get the Trigger
      View getView()
      Get the View
      void noResultQuery(java.lang.String query)
      This method will serve for queries that doesn't need result, for example : CREATE [TABLE|VIEW|TRIGGER]
      java.lang.String[] query(java.lang.String query)
      This method will permit to send query some queries need result (SELECT QUERIES) and some other queries doesn't need result then this method will serve as a filter to start the correct method according to the result
      java.lang.String[] resultQuery(java.lang.String query)
      This method will be used for queries that needs result

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • connectDriver

        public void connectDriver()
        This method will connect the driver JDBC

      • connectionDB

        public void connectionDB(java.lang.String db_name)
        This method connect the user to the DataBase
        Parameters:
        db_name - the name of the db

      • query

        public java.lang.String[] query(java.lang.String query)
        This method will permit to send query some queries need result (SELECT QUERIES) and some other queries doesn't need result then this method will serve as a filter to start the correct method according to the result
        Parameters:
        query - The Query to send to the database
        Returns:
        The result if there is one

      • noResultQuery

        public void noResultQuery(java.lang.String query)
        This method will serve for queries that doesn't need result, for example : CREATE [TABLE|VIEW|TRIGGER]
        Parameters:
        query - The Query to send to the database

      • resultQuery

        public java.lang.String[] resultQuery(java.lang.String query)
        This method will be used for queries that needs result
        Parameters:
        query - The query to send to the database
        Returns:
        A String Array with at the 0 index the name of the table concerned and in at the 1 index the query

        public java.lang.String getDb_Name()
